Transparency.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Thermo Fisher Scientific Supplier Code of Conduct
relevantSources.summary: Supplier code requiring AI transparency, accountability, safety, fairness, reliability, and human-centered design.

relevantSources.title: From Dish to Digital - Thermo Fisher Scientific
relevantSources.summary: Digital transformation ebook discussing AI role in microbiology workflow efficiencies and transparency.

relevantSources.title: 2023 Corporate Social Responsibility Report - Thermo Fisher
relevantSources.summary: CSR report highlighting data transparency enhancements through customer-preferred third-party engagements.

Transparency.findings: Thermo Fisher Scientific demonstrates a strong commitment to transparency in AI, as evidenced by explicit requirements in its supplier code, public-facing reports, and digital transformation documentation. These sources detail organizational expectations for transparency, stakeholder disclosure, and the integration of transparent practices in AI-enabled workflows.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.justification: Score = 1 because 2 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 2022 Corporate Social Responsibility Report
relevantSources.summary: CSR report discussing bias mitigation tools in job descriptions and hiring manager education.

relevantSources.title: 2021 Corporate Social Responsibility Report
relevantSources.summary: CSR report mentioning AI-powered learning technology and diversity initiatives including clinical trial equity.

Fairness & Bias Mitigation.findings: Thermo Fisher Scientific provides concrete evidence of bias mitigation and fairness efforts, particularly in hiring and clinical trial diversity. The CSR reports describe the use of bias mitigation tools, education for hiring managers, and AI-powered technologies supporting equity initiatives.

relevantSources.title: AI Engineer job posting
relevantSources.summary: Job posting requiring familiarity with model interpretability and explainable AI methods.

relevantSources.title: Comprehensive Multiomics Integration - Thermo Fisher Scientific
relevantSources.summary: Research poster using Classification and Regression Trees algorithm for interpretability and accessibility.

relevantSources.title: Intelligent data analytics solutions - Thermo Fisher Scientific
relevantSources.summary: Data analytics solutions providing exploratory data analysis for enhanced interpretability without information loss.

Explainability.findings: The company demonstrates explainability through job postings requiring expertise in interpretable AI, research posters employing explainable models, and analytics solutions designed for user interpretability. These sources show that explainability is embedded in both hiring and product development.

relevantSources.title: Ethics and compliance - Thermo Fisher Scientific
relevantSources.summary: Ethics page establishing top-level executive oversight committees for human rights and artificial intelligence.

relevantSources.title: The SampleManager LIMS Data Analytics Solution
relevantSources.summary: LIMS solution with AI models identifying anomalies and tagging them for human review.

relevantSources.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) in food production
relevantSources.summary: AI food production application describing human training cycles and oversight in AI algorithms.

Human Oversight & Accountability.findings: Thermo Fisher Scientific has established executive oversight for AI and human rights, and implements human-in-the-loop practices in its AI systems. Product documentation and ethics statements show a clear focus on human accountability and intervention in AI processes.

relevantSources.title: OMNIC™ DS Data Security Software
relevantSources.summary: Data security software providing laboratory data integrity and customizable security features.

Privacy & Security.findings: The company addresses AI privacy and security through leadership frameworks, supplier requirements, and technical solutions. There is evidence of formal privacy protocols, data protection standards, and secure software for AI-enabled systems.

Governance & Accountability.justification: Score = 1 because 3 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: Perspectives - Thermo Fisher Scientific
relevantSources.summary: CIO discussing Responsible AI Framework, AI Technology Council, and Generative AI Center of Excellence.

relevantSources.title: Ethics and compliance - Thermo Fisher Scientific
relevantSources.summary: Ethics page establishing executive oversight committees for artificial intelligence and compliance programs.

relevantSources.summary: Software suite with AI-based features supporting security, audit, and electronic signature compliance.

Governance & Accountability.findings: Thermo Fisher Scientific has established AI governance through formal frameworks, councils, and compliance programs. Product and ethics documentation show ongoing oversight, regulatory adherence, and a structured approach to AI risk management.

Public Commitments & External Audits.justification: Score = 1 because 1 source(s) (listed below) contain detailed, verifiable information.

relevantSources.title: 2023 Corporate Social Responsibility Report - Thermo Fisher
relevantSources.summary: CSR report establishing executive oversight committees for artificial intelligence and community engagement programs.

Public Commitments & External Audits.findings: The CSR report provides evidence of public commitments to AI oversight and stakeholder engagement. While there is limited evidence of external audits or certifications, the report demonstrates a willingness to disclose governance structures and community involvement.

summary.overallFindings: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. demonstrates comprehensive responsible AI practices across all seven pillars, with detailed and verifiable evidence for transparency, fairness, explainability, human oversight, privacy, governance, and public commitments. The company integrates responsible AI principles into supplier codes, hiring, product development, and executive oversight structures. Public reports and technical documentation highlight a robust approach to risk management, stakeholder engagement, and continuous improvement in AI governance. No significant gaps were identified, indicating a mature and well-documented responsible AI program.
